Node.definition: = state in which a countable entity is three in number
= man; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man, also known as Belteshazzar; ► main character of the book of Daniel; possibly to be identified with one of three righteous men mentioned in Ezekiel
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

= town; ► capital of Persia (פָּרַס)
= a fortress that commands a city and is used in the control of the inhabitants and in defense during attack or siege.
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= nation ◄ located between Mesopotamia (אֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם) and Persia (פָּרַס) regarded as founded by a person with the same name
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= artificial watercourse ► dug for irrigation purposes

to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= artificial watercourse ► dug for irrigation purposes

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride

= outgrowth of bone encased in hardened skin, often curved and pointed, found in pairs on the heads of cattle, sheep, goats, and other animals; ≈ associated with strength and honor; a raised horn symbolizes confidence and/or pride
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert

= male domestic animal, generally black in color, found in both shorthaired and longhaired varieties, with horns, usually herded together with sheep; ◄ Capra hircus mambrica or Capra hircus angorensis; ► clean animal, source of milk, hides, hair, and horns, may be used for sacrifice; ≈ sometimes associated with demons, regarded as aggressive

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten
literally: sunset; hence: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction towards the setting of the sun

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times

= state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= action by which humans complete a task with the expected or desired outcome

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans or deities have physical, political, or military strength
literally; holy one; hence: = supernatural being in the service of God
= causative action by which a human or deity causes an event or action to be completed with the desired outcome
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state of non existence of a person, place or event
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
literally, to shut or close; hence = action by which a fact or some knowledge is shut or hidden from awareness
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man, also known as Belteshazzar; ► main character of the book of Daniel; possibly to be identified with one of three righteous men mentioned in Ezekiel

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
